website_summaries.verdict: It may not be portable like the PAL, but Tivoli's original table radio delivers a full, rich sound.
pros: auxiliary line-in (doubles as an iPod speaker) and line-out

customer_reviews.title: Nasty Hiss at lower listening volumes
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice radio but has a very nasty Hiss to it that is especially noticeable at lower volume levels. I've researched it and the problem has been corrected on latter models but there is no fix available for this one. I sent it back to Amazon with no problems and am waiting for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Know it all Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good. But
customer_reviews.text: Don't get caught up in the HYPE over this radio. Sound quality is "mediocre", not "audiophile" quality.... as touted. The AM reception is TERRIBLE! The manual tuning dial is "vague" and a pain in the butt to control. I WOULD NOT buy again. Feel like I was "duped" by the hype that's "all over the net" about this brand, and this (particular) radio, could have purchased a "low end" table radio, for a third of the price, and it would have sounded (almost) as good! BUYER BEWARE! GOOD, BIT FAR FROM GREAT! DON'T BUY INTO ALL THE HYPE,
customer_reviews.author: MJ-Bayside, NY

customer_reviews.title: Good, basic radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a person who is completely blind, and not good with tech. The rotary knobs and tuner were a major consideration, together with my own very good experience with other Tivoli Audio devices. It's a very pleasant and convenient table-top radio. Reception with an attached telescopic antenna is lots better than the radio it replaced, and lots better than I expected. Tuning may be strange to 21st-century geeks, but I was able to dredge up ancient memories. From my father-in-law's standpoint, it's how radios are supposed to be. I had no problems with the thing drifting off the selected station, but I haven't used it much beyond confirming that it works.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Squash

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment!!
customer_reviews.text: Really looked forward to getting this little guy!! Just knew this was the “One” I was looking for. NOT””. Looked great. Sounded terrible!! Tuner was junk. Sorry!! Probably just a bad one in the bunch!! They can’t all be this bad!! Mr. Kloss would not be very happy!! Still have a pair of “ Large Advents” he designed. Great then !! Great today!! Thanks HK!!
customer_reviews.author: Razorblade

customer_reviews.title: Spend The Extra Money for Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical with this purchase since the radio system seemed overpriced, but it is worth every penny. The audio is clear on all AM and FM stations and the various ports enable me to connect my android to listen to my playlists. The controls are highly sensitive and the bass is sufficient for a small speaker. The wood structure blends with the surrounding furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Luckicharm

customer_reviews.title: A great little classic radio
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking at this Model One for twenty years. Finally picked one up. The craftsmanship is great and sound quality as well. It's not going to bump and thump the house but for listening to tunes or talk it's great and doesn't look like crap in the living room.
customer_reviews.author: RyanMPLS

customer_reviews.title: Low price for a reason?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the walnut/beige combination which is currently priced between 50 and 70 dollars less than the other color options. The radio was new but I wonder if it wasn't acquired as part some salvage transaction. The paper manual smelled strongly of mildew and the copyright date printed on the box was 2008. That issue aside, the tuning indicator was surprisingly inaccurate. For example, 99.5 FM located at 99.9 on the dial, 91.1 at 91.5, etc. Perhaps the more expensive versions don't exhibit these problems.
customer_reviews.author: PMDMN

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Design, but It Broke out of nowhere
customer_reviews.text: I love the design and simplicity of the dials. The wood looks great in the kitchen. I appreciate craftsmanship and I was looking for a basic radio that would last a long time, which is why I invested into this expensive radio. HOWEVER, on the day it hit 5 years old, the speaker started "popping" with a loud staticy "pop" without a real reason. I hate having to throw away a product that seems so simple.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Corbin

customer_reviews.title: Bad reception
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Sangean WR-11 Wood Cabinet AM/FM Table Top Analog Radio that went on the "Fritz" after 3 years. I looked at the rating for the Tivoli and seemed to be a better option. However, I could not tune in my local NPR station without interference with other FM stations. The antenna didn't help at all. I moved it around the house too. I just want a simple radio that I can plug in and listen to NPR. Why is this so difficult to attain?
customer_reviews.author: cornmaidern

customer_reviews.title: Tivoli Audio Model One M1CLA AM / FM Table Radio - Excellent Sound! Simple Controls.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this radio as a gift for my wife's mom and she is loving it. The sound is really good and reception is good, even though her house has metal siding (she does live in the city so isn't terribly far away from the radio station transmitters). The radio does have external antenna connections for both AM and FM, in case you need them, but the internal antennas are working fine at her location. If you're looking for a great sounding radio with simple controls that won't be confusing to an old person, I think this one would be tough to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Nordin

customer_reviews.title: 2 year later review
customer_reviews.text: I was in love with this radio for the first two years that I've had it, though after keeping it in a very dusty area I'm afraid dust may have gotten inside or theres a different problem. While listening to the radio the light suddenly goes out and an awful noise comes on. I'm hoping I can get it fixed somehow, some users suggested tuning back and forth rapidly but it doesn't seem to help. I hope I can find a place to clean it as this radio was perfect. The sound is amazing and gets very loud, I love that I can plug my phone into it too.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Tivoli Audio Model One Radio
customer_reviews.text: I have an older version of this radio, so I ordered this with confidence to give it as a Christmas gift. It has a sensitive tuner and a longer throw speaker to give a richer, deeper sound that you would not normally get with the cheaper, box store clock radios. You get more fidelity and a richer sound, whether listening to the news with your morning coffee & toast or your favorite classical music station. The tuner is very sensitive and pulls in the stations very clearly. I believe this radio is based on the famous Model One designed by Henry Kloss for the old KLH audio line of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: EarthPlanner

customer_reviews.title: Took a while to get it, but works fine
customer_reviews.text: Size, performance, and quality are just what I wanted. I needed a smaller radio that would capture and hold the stations I like while providing decent sound. I am not a radio engineer, but I am satisfied with this purchase. The look is old style, but I prefer it over its digital counterparts. Over four months of use and I am still satisfied. Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kram

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful retro design
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful retro design. Plugged it in and very weak FM reception. Attached external FM antenna and still poor reception. Not as good FM reception as $30.00 clock radio with no external antenna. Not suitable for purpose intended.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S

customer_reviews.title: I was not disappointed. The tuner is very sensitive and separates a ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a KLH model 1 many years ago so I had high expectations for the Tivoli. I was not disappointed. The tuner is very sensitive and separates a weak station from an adjacent strong one. The sound is amazing and it easily provides background music for half the house. The Tivoli is my new standard dor small FM table radios and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much of what other detractors have said is true :(
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I way over paid for this radio based on the visual design factor. The volume fluctuates constantly while listening to the radio to the point that I am forced to get up and fix it several times per hour. I mostly listen to talk radio on it, and again as others have said it has an awfully low base tone which makes all voices sound booming, further complicating the volume issue. Also, as others have noted, during quiet moments in music there is an annoyingly loud and low buzzing tone which means I cannot use it to listen to music. I'm not sure why I haven't returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great, looks great, worth every cent. I've seen in numerous interior decorating websites. That's how I found it. I don't use the remote control at all so I can't really give any feed back on the remote. The radio is really nice.+
customer_reviews.author: Karen S Peters

customer_reviews.title: Big sound in a tiny box!
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT sound quality and compact size made this a perfect choice for limited spaces! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: fancyNancy

customer_reviews.title: Shoot - I wanted the Bluetooth Model
customer_reviews.text: I am silly. I thought this was the Bluetooth model. It is not. I returned it. That being said these sound pretty great for the size and look really nice! I'll be picking up my second (with Bluetooth!) shortly.
customer_reviews.author: sbrennar

customer_reviews.title: Love this radio
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with this radio when my sister let me borrow hers for a couple years while she was moving. She eventually wanted it back so I bought exactly the same model and this one is good quality also. Great at low or high volumes. I mostly use it to listen to the news (NPR mostly) and there is no distortion.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Radio
customer_reviews.text: FM reception is excellent. AM is very good. Tuning is analog but accurate, and drift is minimal. I was very interested in the auxiliary input performance, as I was planning to use it for a computer speaker. The computer room is too small for my regular sound system, but I often use the computer for playing CDs as well as streaming movies and MP3s. The amplifier and four-inch speaker in the Tivoli is excellent for this environment and these sources. If you want a lot of bells and whistles, this unit is not the one, but as a computer peripheral, it responds very well to the controls in the computer's Audio Manager if you wish to adjust the audio characteristics.
customer_reviews.author: R. Saylor

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Dad, who liked listening to radio, but due to his poor eyesight, couldn't deal with 75 buttons that comes with other manufacturers. He enjoyed this radio and got used to turning it off or changing the station even when is lying down and without getting up to turn on nightstand lamp. It has very small amber colored led, which does not bother at night even if you leave it on. Forget about it being mono, the sound quality is deep and exceptionally good. I bought it for my Dad so he can enjoy it, and he did for several years. You cannot put a price on that.
customer_reviews.author: Technical_Steak

customer_reviews.title: Nice radio, but cheaper options
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice radio. But is is very pricey compared to the Sangean which is similiar. I own both, and the Sangean cost half what this does and looks and sounds as good. Its like buying an Apple product, you pay a premium. Buy the Sangean, save money and get an equal quality radio. I like the Tivoli, but low on value.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Finally - at long last - I have a permanent fix for perfect reception of WFMU!
customer_reviews.text: The best radio I ever got! Finally - at long last - I have a permanent fix for the reception problem I and other radio listeners have when tuning in to the 91.1 band radio station that most formed me, WFMU! It's this! In tandem with the 50 mile 1byone® brand Super Thin HDTV Antenna, for the first time ever, I'm getting FLAWLESS reception of WFMU!!!* - it may be a mono speaker output, but it's a) the key to making the station sound good, b) it's in incredibly efficient speaker, and c) it outputs its stereo reception as a mini-jack accessible stereo signal!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this one for my brother. He heard ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this one for my brother. He heard mine and had to have one for himself.. I bought mine "back in the day" --all those years ago because I was impressed with its resonant sound and its simple yet elegant appearance. It rivals Bose but at much less the cost, This is the one you want!
customer_reviews.author: hommedumonde

customer_reviews.title: Replaces the TV as a background constant
customer_reviews.text: Being that my home has a fabulous multi-function living room just off the kitchen, there is usually some background media playing. Before buying this wonderful, space saving radio, the default was Television of some kind. This radio is perfect for a constant flow of background music, information and a comforting tone. You can plug in an MP3 player or media device as well. It's attractive, easy to use, functional and its sound is superior to plastic radios. It's really not built for playing music at high volume levels, but for moderate to low volume levels, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kim A Miller

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound, easy to accurately tune in.
customer_reviews.text: Very good audio, from a really small radio. Unlike many FM radios this one can be tuned right on the frequency, with little or no distortion of the audio. The sound quality is as good as any radio I have listened to.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: LOVE! 2nd Tivoli. Aux in for phone is great.
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME. This is our Second Tivoli. We've had our old one for 15+ years and it still works great. We're moving it to another location and bought a new one with an Aux in so we could play music/podcasts from our phones. The sound is amazing. It's too bad the bluetooth unit doesn't seem to be 100% great, but we saved $ and went with the non blue-tooth, simple Aux in + cord and are very happy to be able to listen to whatever we want, whenever we want, on the Tivoli. It's still so cute, too. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Best looking lil radio ever!
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these Tivoli Model Ones 15 years ago and was lost during a move. Love it! Got the original model as the new ones with Bluetooth have the Bluetooth branding which kills the clean crisp look! Great price!
customer_reviews.author: Alec Negron

customer_reviews.title: Superb sounding radio
customer_reviews.text: Wow. A GREAT radio at a decent price. I replaced the "Expensive brand" radio with this. The Tivoli has comparable sound and I love the manual tuning. Stations come in sharp and clear. No need to crank the volume........the sound easily fills our living room. Solidly constructed and has a great look. Love this radio. I recommend It to anyone looking for a high performance table top radio. You will not be disappointed. Just turn it on and you'll go, "Wow."
customer_reviews.author: Herbster

customer_reviews.title: I have three of these
customer_reviews.text: I start with the first one: it was a gift, for my office. It is small, classy looking (no veneer), unobstrusive (not a boombox). The sound is powerful, clean, and amazing. I set it to WBGO Newark Jazz radio. People in my office always ask where is the great sound coming from. I was so pleased that I bought one for the bedroom, and one for the kitchen. You can even get a wire to play songs from your I Phone. People, you don't need a remote control. Just reach over and use the dials, which are so nice to touch.
customer_reviews.author: Beatrice Izzey

customer_reviews.title: DON'T buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Below my original review. As time goes by this radio will no longer pick up stations for more that 1-2 seconds. ( NO NOT an exaggeration). It "travels". you get a fairly clear signal and then it's gone. Don't waste your money. I am sorry I wasted my time and money on this awful product. like the old KLH which this replaced when the KLH finally, after over 40 years "bit the dust". Sound is passable. Surprisingly the internal antenna works as well as an external one, which I did buy but was a waste.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hoff

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: Good sound and tuner. My first is a battery operated (rechargeable ) portable. Both are compact. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: 996skipper

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our off-grid cabin. With no utility provided electricity, the 12v source option was what eventually pushed me to this model. The ability to add external antennas is definitely a plus, but the ability to fine tune stations like no other radio is second only to the sound. Amazing is the only word I can use to describe the sound that comes from this little box. Sure, I have "reference" speakers on the dedicated vinyl system and FLAC for the car system that cost more than I would ever admit in public, but this by far is the best radio I have ever heard.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: great sound
customer_reviews.text: The radio is a nice small size and the speakers sound good; it is rather ugly though but works well.
customer_reviews.author: kurt w schiller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I love this radio. It's built exceptionally well, very rugged, and sounds great. Dial is very smooth and good for very fine tuning. The antenna options are great, picking up really difficult stations with the external fm. Sounds very warm and works right out of the box. I enjoy Internet streaming, but it is such a luxury to listen to music on a box that works just by hitting an on button. I will definitely buy another from Tivoli.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sabin

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE COUNTER RADIO
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my kitchen counter and it's compact design works great and takes up only a small amount of space. The sound is good. I am happy with my purchase tho I thought it was a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: CHAR

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Great tone easy analog tuning good reception I own 2 and bought one as a gift. Excellent choice for older folks and mid level audio purists.
customer_reviews.author: lucinda b smith

customer_reviews.title: Small, neat, beautiful legendary radio by Henry Kloss!
customer_reviews.text: Pros) Nice looking, small size, good sound quality comparing its size, high radio receive sensitivity. Cons) All about sound quality - narrow frequency range, low resolution, prone to make white noise in some environment.
customer_reviews.author: Minsu Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent radio but it isn't perfect, and at this price it really should be. I did a head to head comparison with a Sangean WR-12 and the Sangean unit has a more sensitive tuner but the Tivoli has a nicer sound. My main irritation with the Tivoli is that the volume control is very sensitive making it hard to find a comfortable listening volume if the unit is on your desk or next to your bed.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Neil

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Despite some of the negative reviews, I decided to purchase this radio for my home office. WOW! It sounds great, looks great, is easy to tune and sounds terrific with my iPod. No learning curve, unpacked and up and running in less than five minutes. Unlike others, no reception problems with either AM or FM. Do not hesitate to give this beauty a try. The headphone output is in stereo if you prefer to listen this way. Got mine new for less than 100 bucks. Keep trying the price, it changes during the day. I was also very pleased with the third party source. I got it well before the estimated date. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: texvegas

customer_reviews.title: lacking just a little...
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound the radio produces very much. I only use it to listen to the Red Sox. I find 2 things a little disappointing. Although the tuning dial has a ratio that gives you some extra turning to tune in the right spot, the exact station location is easy to tune past (for the broadcast I am looking for) and the little yellow light doesn't have much leeway with respect to brightness. The antenna must be positioned just so for any of this to happen. I do not know whether an FM antenna would fix this or not. The good antennas are not cheap and I was trying to keep my investment to the price of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: A thing of beauty . . .
customer_reviews.text: I love this radio, and was heart broken when I discovered it had been taken when our office was burgled the other day. Luckily, Tiovli still had the Original Model One in cherry wood. Unfortunately though, the reasonable cost of the radio didn't reach the deductible for insurance purposed, so I had to pay out of pocket! A great little radio! Ray
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Love it, Hate it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Tivoli because of it discriminator. It can fine tune any station and ignore the harmonics. I bought two - one upstairs and one down. However, after a year both tuners developed a scratching noise - like dust in the old capacitive tuners - except you can't clean it. The broadcast sound is rich and bold, about as good as a well known "wave radio". I now hate the tuner on this radio, but I use the auxillary input jack for other units and I love this radio. It is a handsome unit with a very nice wooden case. I am sure the wood helps with the sound.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, but AUX mode is defective.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this radio, but unfortunately I am having to return it. When the radio is switched to the AUX mode I can still hear the AM radio playing. I don't know if this is a widespread defect or not, but at this price I expect a radio to work perfectly. That being said, the speaker really did have a nice rich and warm sound to it, so I wish the mode settings would have worked properly and I could have kept it.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: This is a great radio
customer_reviews.text: Great looking radio. Well built, surprisingly heavy. Extraordinarily good sound from such a small radio. I am really happy with both the looks and the quality of the sound.
customer_reviews.author: dudleyamazon

customer_reviews.title: Tivoli's Little Radio is Best
customer_reviews.text: This very simple to use and has a great sound. I put a Seiko alarm clock on top of it. So, together, they make a great clock radio!!
customer_reviews.author: Donelson

customer_reviews.title: Another Classic from Henry Kloss
customer_reviews.text: Like an earlier design from KLH (Model 21, also designed by Henry Kloss), this is a compact radio that delivers impressive sound! The analog design is a nostalgic touch of earlier times before digital tuning and menus were the norm. Unlike the KLH Model 21, the Tivoli Model One covers both FM and AM bands, and provides an auxiliary input for external sources (e.g. CD & MP3 players). It does not provide bass/treble controls, but these are hardly missed. One minor fault... the tuning dial is slightly offset from the actual FM/AM frequencies. Looks like a mis-adjustment off the tuning knob. Overall, a great set for its size and price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent little table radio
customer_reviews.text: The sound of this radio is far bigger than its size, especially in the bass response. A solid, heavy little unit with nice walnut veneer. Feels like it is built to last. If you are looking for a small table radio for your desk at work and don't want a cheesy plastic clock radio, this is a very nice choice. The bass response is almost too much for classical music, but I'm not complaining. Tivoli has made a nice Sirius satellite version of the radio. If you are inclined to subscribe to Sirius, that would be a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: This radio looks great and the tuning function works very well
customer_reviews.text: This radio looks great and the tuning function works very well, better than many other radios I have had. It can pick up some faint stations even without the external antenna and the tuning nob had a great feel to it. However, the sound quality is a big disappointment. Even given that it is a mono speaker system, the sound seems muddier than it should be. I have an older 70's mono clock radio, that has better dynamic range than this model.
customer_reviews.author: apamazon

customer_reviews.title: radio
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good radio and I hope it will last. I expected a bit better FM reception, and am trying to determine how to run a longer antenna. I was looking for a few more features and wish it had a USB plug. and presets. I don't miss the Stero at all It is interesting they thought to incorporate the on/off switch into the FM/Am/Aux knob rather than the Volume. It is a good radio and I would recommend it. jt
customer_reviews.author: john turner

customer_reviews.title: Great design, but very poor radio reception
customer_reviews.text: This is a well designed radio with excellent sound quality if you can connect your ipod. However, the FM radio reception is terrible. I can't even pick up local radio stations that comes in loud and strong in my car. When I do get a signal, the audio fades in and out when you walk around the room. For a type of technology as simple as a radio, I would think Tivoli would have mastered the antenna. Now I have to go out and buy one just to make this a worthwhile investment.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves this radio, but after only two ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this radio, but after only two years, it has turned into a piece of junk. Static, thumping noises. Don't buy this radio!
customer_reviews.author: Alacia

customer_reviews.title: decent radio
customer_reviews.text: bought as a gift as it had a external antenna connector.
customer_reviews.author: kc2ttt

customer_reviews.title: The Little Giant
customer_reviews.text: This radio is terrific!! Simple, clean design yet big sound.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Ann Engdahl

customer_reviews.title: Looks aren't everything
customer_reviews.text: This is a good looking radio, BUT, I have a huge problem with the FM reception. The only time I get good FM reception is on a cloudy day. I'm in Arizona, so that doesn't help. No where does it tell you how to find an FM antenna for this radio that does the job. My old timey boom box does a better job than this without the antenna. Why do they try to market this for visually impaired?
customer_reviews.author: Highplains

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Table Radiio
customer_reviews.text: It is not fancy, but is high tech and has an attractive wooden cabinet. The controls are simple. I like that the radio can pull in distant and near stations with ease. The analog tuner has extra fine tuning and a light glows bright amber when you are tuned right on the station. When you listen to this high tech radio, it is hard to believe that it is mono and not stereo because the sound is so brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Detjen

customer_reviews.title: Finally I went ahead and ordered it and I couldn't be more pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I held off on buying this table radio because I wasn't able to listen to one in my area. Finally I went ahead and ordered it and I couldn't be more pleased with my purchase. It is well constructed, attractive, and simple to operate. The sound is terrific and the reception excellent. I listen to mostly classical, a station I have had some trouble with in the past, and this radio brings my music in perfectly. I strongly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Engh

customer_reviews.title: Tivoli Radio
customer_reviews.text: Mainly I would like to mention that the provider, Total Interior Trim Supply, Inc., in Watkins, CO, sent the Tivoli Radio sooner than the time estimated by a few days. The Radio arrived in perfect condition and complete. And it was well packaged. I find it enigmatic why the Total Interior Trim Supply, Inc. got such a poor review by others. The Tivoli Audio Model One Radio works perfectly. It performs exactly as advertised by the manufacturers. I highly recommend both the Tivoli Audio Model One Radio and Total Interior Trim Supply, Inc.
customer_reviews.author: Carvel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Pricy but worth It.
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, good sound, and if I want to listen to music from my iphone through the radio speaker I can plug it into the aux port on the rear.
customer_reviews.author: BKR

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic little radio
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic little radio! I've got it sitting next to my bed, and the sound is easily enough to fill the whole room, I can hear it perfectly from my desk at the other end. The tuning knob is an absolute joy to use, and will leave you ruined for most other radio control panels. The included FM antenna leaves a little bit to be desired. It's just a length of wire with a coaxial connector on the end. Grab a solid antenna likethat I picked up and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Very dissatisfied with this radio. It never worked properly and especially difficult to get SOME stations
customer_reviews.author: Ricki

customer_reviews.title: Tivoli Audio Model One M1CLA AM / FM Table Radio, Classic / Walnut
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small powerful well built radio for my wood shop. Purchasing a quality, durable product was my first concern. This Item is built with grate craftsmanship. It feels solid and is quit substantial in weight. Also the quality of the sound it produces is amazing for its size. The tuning dial, volume and power knobs are well crafted. They move very fluid and smooth. I am very happy with this Purchase and would recommend Tivoli to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: good quality, fine sound
customer_reviews.text: Classic styling, good quality, fine sound. If you want an "old-school" analog-style radio and are willing to pay for it, this is for you. I like mine. But if you skip around between stations, you might find this frustrating. A "tuning light" helps you fine-tune to the desired station. The FM antennae wire is okay, but don't look it to draw in remote stations.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Kunkel

customer_reviews.title: Headphone stereo a surprise
customer_reviews.text: I just received this model M1CLA Henry Kloss Model One AM / FM Table Radio yesterday. I figured a monaural radio was fine for the bed stand. As I was listening on headphones, I was surpised to find that the output to headphones was in stereo. I checked the accompanying manual and it lists headphone output as stereo so I know it wasn't just my imagination, definitely stereo. On the down side, the dial indicator is not quite calibrated, off by about about 1 mhz so I deducted one star. Otherwise all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Avid listener

customer_reviews.title: I really want to love it...
customer_reviews.text: The design is perfect, simple and beautiful, sound is adequate from such a small unit. my problem is when used with a iPhone via the aux jack on the back there is awful feedback I can never seem to get the phone positioned to eliminate it. This tivoli if fine if you're going to use the am/fm radio, but I would look for alternatives if you plan to hood up a phone for playback of music.
customer_reviews.author: anthony c kelley

customer_reviews.title: A nice little radio in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: We have many good stations locally and this is a great receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth H. Leech

customer_reviews.title: Reminds me of the quality things the USA made back in the 40s and 50s.
customer_reviews.text: Made in the USA. Sound is clear and is perfect for talk radio. The tuning knob is geared to be very precise and with the tuning light you know when you have hit the sweet spot. The build quality far exceeds my expectation. Nothing cheap about this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J

customer_reviews.title: At this price, it shouldn't hum!!!
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly I'm VERY picky, but at this price point, this radio should be SILENT when there's no music playing. But no, there's a very faint but noticeable hum both on the FM and the AUX settings. And yes, I tried it in different outlets and positions. Too bad, because the audio from this little box is quite remarkable. Returned for a refund...wasn't willing to try another one.
customer_reviews.author: D-Deaf

customer_reviews.title: This radio is all that I hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a valley where radio reception is sketchy. After reading the reviews about this set I decided to try it. It has no problem receiving stations where other radios could not. The tuning led is great for fine tuning. In technical terms it has excellent sensitivity and selectivity. The tone quality is great. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality sound & poor am reception
customer_reviews.text: No tone control means you are stuck with muffled voices. Also, poor AM reception.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelO

customer_reviews.title: Love this little unit
customer_reviews.text: Love this little unit, just wish I didn't have to cycle though the AM/FM radio every time to get the AUX turned on, it's unnecessarily noisy
customer_reviews.author: rose

customer_reviews.title: a very good radio at its price
customer_reviews.text: This is indeed a very good radio, the best I ever had at this price range. At low volumn, the sound quality is good and well balanced, which I think is what it's intended for, and the reception is also excellent. The one thing I hope that can be better is the material of the control knobs (both volumn and on/off swith), it is made of cheap plastic and has lousy feel to it. Other than that, it is a excellent radio and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Yeong Lin

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound quality for such a small radio
customer_reviews.text: Superb sound on both FM and AM. Internal antennas pick up all the stations to which I like to listen. Excellent build quality and layout of controls.
customer_reviews.author: tandiman

customer_reviews.title: A Solid Choice
customer_reviews.text: The following was written by my father, an elderly disabled veteran who is nearly blind, and who thus takes his radios seriously: The Tivoli Model One is a delight both to the eyes and to the ears. The rich walnut cabinet enhances my bedside table. The sound from such a small radio is wonderful. The tuning is precise, and although I live in a rural area, it is powerful enough to give me all my favorite stations.
customer_reviews.author: heavy-duty reader

customer_reviews.title: absolutely fabulous !
customer_reviews.text: this radio is exceptional.it is a single speaker and not a stereo but sounds better than units five times it's size and cost. i now realize that the radio i normally listen to and thought was good {a name brand} sounds lousy next to the model one.also it's a nice change to get away from the standard digital age look of everythihg else on the market. back to basics never sounded so good. you will not regret buying this radio. you will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Fields

customer_reviews.title: Best sound in a small box
customer_reviews.text: Best radio ever. Great sound in a small box. Made me fall in love with AM /FM all over again. Looks so good in any house.
customer_reviews.author: Contractor Man

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 2011. Still performing perfectly in 2020.
customer_reviews.text: Still love my Tivoli model One. I only wish they would bring back the matching satellite speaker which was closed out and discontinued at the same time as I was making my 2011 purchase.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Tivoli radio lives up to their name right out of the box. The sound quality is rich. The base gives a depth to audio and music that is just pleasant to hear. And it's a table radio. I would recommend this radio and the Tivoli name . Pam B.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: I've had this model for about 8 years. Last ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this model for about 8 years. Last night it fell from a loft balcony 10 ft. onto hardwood floor below. Listening to in now, still crystal clear, with a mashed corner of wood paneling. There isn't many products that are made this way anymore. Rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Your Friend

customer_reviews.title: Hummm...
customer_reviews.text: Well made with excellent reception. However after one week of use the radio developed a low level and rather annoying humming sound, somewhat like the old 60 Hz hum analog radios would sometimes generate if improperly grounded. Hum is present with the volume set at the lowest level and changing power sources makes no difference.
customer_reviews.author: caeasterling

customer_reviews.title: Superior product
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Sounds great. Added the external antennas and now have great reception in my concrete office. Worth a few extra bucks to have something nice.
customer_reviews.author: asb

customer_reviews.title: Tivoli: Excellent Sound from a Small Radio
customer_reviews.text: Crisp clear FM reception. Excellent sound. Bass port on bottom of all wood cabinet adds good low end sound. Very high quality Tivoli product. Tivoli is not an inexpensive radio, and it is worth every penny. Comes with a single wire FM antenna. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Packer Fan

customer_reviews.title: Not what was advertised! Need to return it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas gift and I am not happy with it. The reception has a lot of static and I want to send this back.
customer_reviews.author: kmh

customer_reviews.title: I waited a long time to buy a good radio for my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I waited a long time to buy a good radio for my kitchen, and this is the perfect one.
customer_reviews.author: A writer in NJ

customer_reviews.title: Not great for the price
customer_reviews.text: The internal antenna just wasn't cutting it in my house, and the tuning was off. I would have to add an FM external antenna and try that out, but for the price it just wasn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: babybird112

customer_reviews.title: Crystal Clear
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and reception! Located this radio on a kitchen counter, in a corner, under a cabinet, 10 feet from closest window, no extra antenna. Radio stations (am and fm) come through crystal clear. Cannot say the same for competitor with S name. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jon V

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I simply love this radio. Excellent build quality - the switches have a "Mercedes" quality to them and the tonal quality is excellent. I play my iPhone through the auxiliary input and it has never sounded better. Radio reception is astounding. I can't move the dial a fraction of an inch without capturing another station.
customer_reviews.author: David Booker

customer_reviews.title: Fair as far as the radio goes. Not very ...
customer_reviews.text: Fair as far as the radio goes. Not very high quality in terms of audio, but again fair for the size, though not for the price. Definitely avoid the fake woofer that you can buy along with: no appreciable difference to sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jearly, The Movie

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money invested.
customer_reviews.text: The radio fulfilled my expectations at reasonable price. Very happy with sound and reception.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Neal

customer_reviews.title: A fine istrument
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this receiver, and I plan to give a few as family gifts. The sound is excellent. I listen only to non-commerical radio, including classical music on WQXR, jazz on WBGO, and news / public affairs on WNYC. On all three stations, the sound is quite good. I plan to purchase another one for my office.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Sounds and looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound from a small cool-looking table-top radio. I would say that if you're even thinking about this, buy it. I love it so far. The easy to attach and remove antenna that comes with it works great for weaker stations. I'm glad I didn't buy a separate antenna. Update: I see other reviews saying this radio craps out after a year or so. So far I love mine and it still works perfectly after about 6mo. I guess I'll keep my fingers crossed. I live in a rural area. I rarely have to hook up the antenna, and when I do it's just to make ok reception perfect.
customer_reviews.author: HC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A fine little radio, great sound, great reception, keeps me company all day long at work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Very Stylish Radio with an Exceptionally Small Footprint
customer_reviews.text: Very attractive, small enough to be placed virtually anywhere. Audio quality is reasonable considering the very small speaker, but may be disappointing to some. Fit and finish is excellent, wood cabinet is exceptionally attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Steward H.

customer_reviews.title: This radio has such good sound and looks so sharp in our kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This radio has such good sound and looks so sharp in our kitchen. We hope to have it for many decades to come!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea and Justin

customer_reviews.title: Buy one!
customer_reviews.text: I'd been relying on the radio part of my aiwa cd player--mostly classical on local station. When the tivoli came I couldnn't believe the difference. The treble, the base--I had been missing half the sound! All this without additional speakers, in a tiny footprint, without drifting and static. Besides outperforming any radio I've ever had, it wasn't designed by Darth Vader to look like part of a space ship. You turn it on with a knob and it goes. Buy one!
customer_reviews.author: SynF

customer_reviews.title: Take complaints seriously
customer_reviews.text: After some 25 years the old stereo radio finally began to give up its ghost. What to buy next? We listen to 3 or 4 FM stations only. Liking Mr. Kloss's design and not paying sufficient attention to complaints in other reviews resulted in a purchase a few weeks ago, a step I now thoroughly regret. The FM station we listen to most is only 12 miles away. We are regularly annoyed by the drift of the tuner that requires constant adjustment. In addition, the sound at regular levels is poor. Ready to chuck the piece. So much for Henry Kloss. Buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kuehni

customer_reviews.title: We are in an area that has poor AM reception and this radio is disappointing as far ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he likes it. He listens mainly to FM radio. We are in an area that has poor AM reception and this radio is disappointing as far as bringing in AM stations.
customer_reviews.author: Marie D.

customer_reviews.title: Good Radio
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality for a small radio. I've got it located in a tough spot and it does well bringing in the Local and some distant FM stations. AM reception isn't as strong. Picks up the stronger local stations, but reception is weak on distant AM stations.
customer_reviews.author: H.J.

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my elderly mother, she really likes it, it is easy for her to operate. Reception is good when placed the right location, antenna doesn't seem to make much difference. Sound is very good even when the volume is turned up.
customer_reviews.author: cerealshopper

product_meta.title: Tivoli Audio model One Am/ fm Table Radio, Classic/ Walnut, 2.4 Lb
product_meta.description:
Tivoli Audio Model one am/ FM table radio, classic/ walnut

AMAZON.COM
The Tivoli Model One has been praised far and wide for its high-quality sound, small size, and cool, retro styling. We got our hands on a sample unit and came away impressed, just as many others have. Anyone who wants a compact, stylish radio with surprisingly good sound should give the Model One a look.

 Design
In many ways, the Model One is the culminating achievement of famed audio engineer Henry Kloss's long career. Designed from the ground up by Kloss, who passed away in 2002, the radio exudes understated class and elegant simplicity. We received the Platinum Series Model One, which features a hand-lacquered, high gloss dark walnut cabinet that is simply gorgeous. According to Tivoli, the genuine wood casing isn't just for looks as it provides "an acoustically inert housing" that maximizes the speaker's sound quality. At just over 8 inches wide, 4.5 inches high, and 5.25 inches deep, the Model One is about the size of a toaster turned on its side-- plenty small to fit on a desk, dresser, or nightstand.

 The Model One's single rotary dial handles tuning for both AM and FM stations. It feels sturdy and smooth in the hand. The dial is designed to move between stations at a speed that is a bit slower than the speed at which the user turns the knob-- a 5 to 1 ratio, to be exact. This "ratio" dialing technique makes it far easier to tune stations accurately and quickly. It's a nice touch that sets the unit apart from other desktop radios.

 The tuner band selection and volume dials are easy to control. Plus, they're well designed for hands of all sizes. A small LED power indicator, as well as an LED that helps determine signal strength, are positioned between the dials. We liked the light-colored face and dark lettering printed on the Platinum Series model we reviewed; it made for easy operation in dimly-lit rooms. The Model One's single, 3" driver is protected by a handsome metal speaker cover. Tivoli adds that the speaker is enhanced by a "multi-stage frequency contouring circuit that adjusts the speaker's output over half-octave increments." The result, Tivoli claims, is "musically accurate tonal balance and bass response."

 The back of the unit features a coaxial antenna jack for the included FM antenna wire. While the Model One also has an internal FM antenna, Tivoli recommends using the supplied external one for tricky tuning in locales with a lot of stations crammed together. There's a handy switch for switching between the internal and external antennae. A standard 3.5mm headphone jack is also provided, as is a 3.5mm auxiliary line in port for plugging in your iPod or other music device. If you want to use the Model One as a component tuner-- not a bad idea given the overall quality and accuracy of the tuning circuitry-- Tivoli has provided a 3.5mm output port. The back panel also sports separate ports for AC and DC power, making the unit a great choice for boating or RV use.

 Listening Pleasure
As with the Tivoli iPal portable speaker system, we were initially skeptical about the performance of a small, one-speaker unit that only offers monaural sound. The reality is that most small two-speaker systems don't allow you to place the speakers very far apart anyway, and the Model One's rich, resonant sound more than made up for its lack of true stereo separation. Plus, the Model One is a single, elegant box with no annoying speaker cords.

 While the Model One isn't designed to provide earth-shattering sound at high volume, it produces surprising clarity and fullness at normal listening levels. When turned all the way up, the unit's rich sound persists and we suspect that Tivoli engineered the Model One's volume level to max out before any distortion arises. If you don't need a lot of volume, the Model One delivers. As with the iPal, we were left scratching our heads and wondering how such great sound could come from such a little box.

 The Model One's tuning accuracy is also impressive; we were able to dial in stations we didn't even know existed. Tivoli says this is due to the unit's discrete-component FM tuner technology, which was originally developed for cellular telephones. Whatever Tivoli has done here, they did it right; closely-spaced stations are a breeze to tune.

 Pros


 * Compact form factor 
 * Excellent sound 
 * Supremely accurate tuning 

Cons
 * Not engineered to produce extremely high volume levels 



FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The Tivoli Audio® Model One® AM/FM table radio has been described as the best sounding table radio ever made,(MSNBC) offering the kind of room-filling sound that many other radios claim to deliver but often don't. (Forbes) MORE PRODUCTS BY TIVOLI AUDIO
 Where performance and simplicity are paramount but space is sparse, the Model One table radio fits the bill. With just three knobs, it is the antithesis of today's ever more complex electronic products. The Model One gets more stations than other radios because of its state of the art, Henry Kloss designed discrete-component FM tuner using technology originally developed for cellular telephones. This technology gives better FM reception and increased clarity on closely spaced stations. Features include a furniture-grade, handmade wood cabinet that doubles as an acoustically inert housing and a heavy-magnet, long-throw 3-inch speaker that provides musically accurate tonal balance and bass response. Its large analog-tuning knob with geared-down 5:1 tuning ratio permits easy and accurate tuning. The amber tuning indicator lets you know when you've achieved proper tuning. Built-in AM and FM antennas provide satisfying reception.

Like all Tivoli Audio products, the Model One AM/FM table radio is compatible with iPod and other mp3 players through the auxiliary input offered on the back of the unit. It also offers an external FM antenna input that allows for improved tuning in difficult reception areas, as well as a headphone jack, and a record output for recording, or to use the Model One as a high-quality outboard tuner.

Available in several finishes such as Walnut/Beige, Black Ash/Silver, Cherry/Cobalt Blue, Maple/Hunter Green, Cherry/Silver, and White/Silver.

The Model one is also made available through Platinum Series collection in Piano Black/Silver and Dark Walnut/Beige or the Frost White Collection in the following finishes; Frost White/Atlantic Blue, Frost White/ Kelly Green, Frost White/Ember Red, Frost White/Sunflower Yellow, and Frost White/Snow White.

An external FM antenna and 9' power cord are included in the box. One year warranty.
